Ornstein was a perfectionist, and it showed in the hardware he built, while Walden brought with him both his knowledge of real-time systems and a resolute willingness to work long hours. Cosell had the ability to burrow into complex software programs and find bugs faster than anyone else at BBN. Because of this, Cosell was one of the company’s human insurance policies: Projects would be worked on by teams, but every BBN manager knew that if his project got into trouble, he could throw Cosell into the job and superhuman things would happen in a hurry. Although there remained a great deal of detailed design work, among them the team members understood the most important technical issues.

当团队开始工作时，哈特已经知道接下来会发生什么：连续四个星期不分昼夜地工作。每天晚上六点半，哈特都要回家吃晚饭，他总是准时回家。但晚饭后，他躲进了书房，直到家人入睡很久后才出来。

一个重要的初始决定是使用哪种硬件。可靠性是哈特最关心的问题。他在林肯实验室为军方建造天线和雷达系统的十五年经验教会了他可靠性高于一切。哈特凭直觉认为，那些将在大学现场摆弄 IMP 的研究生会忍不住要碰这些设备。他曾经是一名学生，他甚至可能做过他所担心的——见鬼，他知道——他们会尝试做的事情。他们会在盒子里四处寻找它的工作原理。

As the team got started, Heart already knew what was in store: four weeks of working around the clock. Heart was expected home for dinner every evening at six-thirty, and he always made it. But after dinner he disappeared into his study and didn’t emerge until long after his family had gone to bed.

An important initial decision was which hardware to use. Reliability was, by far, Heart’s chief concern. His fifteen years at Lincoln Lab building antennae and radar systems for the military had taught him to worry about reliability above all else. Intuitively, Heart believed that the graduate students who would be knocking around the IMPs at the university sites wouldn’t be able to keep their hands off the equipment. He had been a student, and he had probably even done the very kinds of things he feared—hell, heknew—they would try to do. They’d go poking around in the box to see how it worked.

哈特的选择有限。小型计算机行业还比较年轻。其领导者是数字设备公司和霍尼韦尔。从一开始，可靠性问题就让哈特青睐新型霍尼韦尔 DDP-516，这种机器安装在重型钢柜中。海军以制定严格的工程标准而闻名。BBN 的一些人认识霍尼韦尔的一些人，他们在离 BBN 剑桥工厂不远的一家工厂制造了这种机器。516 还帮助哈特消除了好奇的研究生可能会因乱捣乱而导致网络瘫痪的担忧。知道 IMP 将安装在一个可以经受战争考验的盒子里，他可以放心多了。

Heart’s choices were limited. The minicomputer industry was still relatively young. Its leaders were Digital Equipment and Honeywell. From the start, the reliability issue led Heart to favor the new Honeywell DDP-516, the machine housed in the heavy-duty steel cabinet. The Navy had a reputation for setting rigorous engineering standards. And some of BBN’s people knew some of Honeywell’s people, who made the machine at a plant not far from BBN’s Cambridge location. The 516 also helped to settle Heart’s fear that inquisitive graduate students might bring down the network with their tinkering. He could rest much easier knowing the IMPs would be housed in a box built to withstand a war.

霍尼韦尔计算机的复杂输入/输出 (I/O) 功能（即它与调制解调器等外部设备通信的速度和效率）也帮助它登上了榜首。由于处理 I/O 流量是 IMP 的主要功能，因此具有良好 I/O 结构的机器绝对必不可少。

The functionality of the Honeywell computer’s sophisticated input/output (I/O) capability—the speed and efficiency with which it could communicate with external devices such as modems—also helped propel it to the top of the list. As the handling of I/O traffic was the main function of the IMP, a machine with a good I/O structure was absolutely essential.

撰写提案不久，戴夫·沃尔登就开始觉得自己可能力不从心。作为哈特为该项目带来的第一位程序员，沃尔登在早期对一般编码问题进行了大量思考，并制作了一些原始图表，以块的形式勾勒出程序的逻辑流程和时间安排。沃尔登已经概述了足够多的程序，意识到他们正在做一件困难的事情。他认为 ARPA 的提案将提供一个很好的借口，招募威尔·克劳瑟 (Will Crowther) 来领导软件工作，沃尔登曾在林肯为这位天才程序员工作过。沃尔登一点也不介意聘请比他高的人。他对自己的才能很有信心，可以摆脱可能让很多人担心的等级制度问题。两人曾在林肯密切合作，沃尔登更乐意与克劳瑟共事，而不是在没有他的团队中。此外，克劳瑟非常出色。

Not long into writing the proposal, Dave Walden began feeling that he might be out of his depth. As the first programmer Heart brought to the project, Walden did a lot of the early thinking about general coding issues, and he did some of the original charts sketching out in block form the logical flow and timing of the program. Walden had outlined enough of the program to realize they were undertaking something difficult. He decided that the ARPA proposal would provide a good excuse to recruit Will Crowther, the ingenious programmer for whom Walden had worked at Lincoln, to lead the software effort. Walden wasn’t in the least reluctant to bring in someone above him. He was confident enough in his own talents to shrug off pecking-order concerns that might worry a lot of other people. The two had worked closely at Lincoln, and Walden was happier to be on a team with Crowther than on one without him. And besides, Crowther was exceptional.

让 Crowther 加入团队不仅会增加软件成功的可能性，而且 BBN 的 Crowther 会让工作变得更加愉快。Crowther 性格安静，容易合作，在编写代码时，他简直是鼓舞人心的。他还是 Ornstein 的好朋友和攀岩伙伴。Crowther 似乎在用指尖悬挂在门框上做引体向上时注意力最集中。他还以数学涂鸦而闻名。在其他人通过画曲线和花饰来打发漫长的会议时间时，Crowther 却在纸上画满了一堆微分方程。

Having Crowther on the team wouldn’t just boost the chances of making the software work. Having Crowther at BBN would make doing the work more pleasant. Crowther was quiet, easy to work with, and when it came to writing code, he was downright inspiring. He was also Ornstein’s good friend and rock-climbing companion. Crowther seemed to concentrate best while hanging from door frames by his fingertips, doing chinups. And he was known for his mathematical doodling. While others passed the time at lengthy meetings by drawing squiggles and curlicues, Crowther filled his page with a thicket of differential equations.

沃尔登、哈特和奥恩斯坦非常肯定，自从哈特离开后，克劳瑟在林肯并不完全开心。克劳瑟喜欢为哈特工作，在林肯向哈特汇报工作时，他已经习惯了看到事情进展顺利。哈特离开后，很多为他工作的人又回去做效率较低的修修补补了。奥恩斯坦打电话给克劳瑟说：“威利，你应该来 BBN”，克劳瑟欣然同意了。

Walden, Heart, and Ornstein were pretty sure that Crowther hadn’t been entirely happy at Lincoln since Heart had left. Crowther liked working for Heart, and while reporting to Heart at Lincoln, he had grown accustomed to seeing things built. After Heart left, a lot of the people who had worked for him had gone back to less productive tinkering. Ornstein called Crowther and said, “Willy, you ought to come to BBN,” to which Crowther readily agreed.

Crowther 的加入，让 BBN 获得了无价的财富。他擅长编写复杂、严谨的代码，这正是 IMP 所需要的。事实上，编写小而复杂的代码是 Crowther 一生中最大的乐趣之一。他的代码是与他共事的人见过的最精简的代码之一。由于 IMP 需要连接到电话线，数据不断进出，因此其想法是让数据包到达 IMP，进行处理，然后立即发送或放入队列中等待轮到它 — 所有这些都比打个响指还要短。每条指令的执行时间都是一到两百万分之一秒（微秒）。由于每条不必要的指令都会多花一到两微秒的时间，因此每个小任务或软件代码都必须极其节俭地编写，使用尽可能少的指令。

In Crowther, BBN gained an invaluable addition. He specialized in producing complex, tightly written pieces of code, which were exactly what was required in the IMP. In fact, writing small intricate bits of code was one of Crowther’s greatest pleasures in life. His code was among the leanest anyone who worked with him had ever seen. Since the IMPs were to be hooked up to phone lines, with data constantly flowing in and out, the idea was to have a data packet arrive at an IMP, be processed, and immediately either be sent forward or placed in a queue to await its turn—all in less time than it took to snap your fingers. Every instruction took one or two millionths of a second (microseconds) to execute. Since every unnecessary instruction ate up one or two extra microseconds, each little task, or piece of software code, had to be written with intense frugality, using the fewest instructions possible.

网络设计的核心思想是 IMP 子网应隐形运行。例如，如果坐在加州大学洛杉矶分校主机旁的人想登录犹他大学的计算机，则连接应显示为直接连接。用户不必担心子网的存在。其效果类似于电话系统中的直接拨号，使呼叫者免于等待接线员接通电话的烦恼。就像电话公司的自动交换设备迷宫一样，IMP 对用户来说应该是“透明的”。正如 Roberts 在征集提案中所描述的那样，“每个发送主机都通过其相邻的 IMP 查看网络，并看到自己已连接到接收主机。”

Central to the design of the network was the idea that the subnet of IMPs should operate invisibly. So, for instance, if someone seated at a host computer at UCLA wanted to log on to a computer at the University of Utah, the connection should appear to be direct. The user should not have to be bothered with the fact that a subnet even existed. The effect was similar to direct dialing in the telephone system, which freed callers from the annoyance of having to wait for an operator to make their connections. Like the maze of automated switching equipment at a phone company, the IMPs were to be “transparent” to the user. As Roberts described it in the call for proposals, “Each transmitting host looks into the network through its adjacent IMP and sees itself connected to the receiving host.”

为了实现这种透明度，网络必须快速、无拥塞、极其可靠。这些都是罗伯茨在提案请求中写明的相对简单的要求，但没有人想到实际实现这些要求会很容易。

To achieve that transparency, the network was going to have to be fast, free of congestion, and extremely reliable. These were relatively straightforward requirements that Roberts had written into the request for proposals, but no one expected that actually accomplishing them would be easy.

然而，BBN 软件团队发现的第一件事就是，他们可以让代码每秒处理十倍于 Roberts 要求的数据包数量。在做其他事情之前，Crowther 和 Walden 编写了内循环（程序的核心）的代码，并计算了指令数量。Roberts 本来对内循环有 1,500 条指令就很满意了，而 Crowther 和 Walden 只用了 150 条。据此，两位程序员计算出 IMP 处理每个数据包的速度。有了这些信息，他们就能预测每秒可以移动多少个数据包。“我们坐下来写了 150 行代码，计算了它们的数量，然后我们就知道了，”Crowther 说。他们已经搞清楚了内核。

However, one of the first things BBN’s software team discovered was that they could make the code process ten times the number of packets per second that Roberts was requiring. Before doing anything else, Crowther and Walden wrote the code for the inner loop—the heart of the program—and counted the number of instructions. Roberts would have been content with an inner loop of 1,500 instructions; Crowther and Walden used 150. From that, the two programmers calculated just how quickly the IMP could process each packet. With that information, they were able to predict how many packets could be moved per second. “We actually sat down and wrote the hundred and fifty lines of code, counted them, and then we knew,” Crowther said. They had figured out the kernel.

“我们认为让这个系统运行起来会很困难，”BBN 在提案中含糊其辞地写道。BBN 团队以这种谨慎的方式让罗伯茨知道，他们不会将这项复杂性史无前例、概念具有革命性且充满了可行性不确定的技术细节的任务视为理所当然。然而，该提案随后表明，BBN 似乎已经解决了这个问题。

“We take the position that it will be difficult to make the system work,” BBN wrote hedgingly in its proposal. In this cautious way the BBN team let Roberts know that it didn’t take for granted a task that was unprecedented in its complexity, revolutionary in concept, and filled with technical details of uncertain feasibility. Yet the proposal then went on to demonstrate that BBN seemed to have the problem solved.

提案完成后，长达 200 页，花费 BBN 超过 10 万美元，这是该公司在如此高风险的项目上花费的最高金额。BBN 团队已经完成了 IMP 的大部分设计，整个系统的很大一部分已经明确定义。BBN 的最终提案更像是蓝图，而不是大纲。其工程师为 IMP 和网络设计了测试程序和定期性能检查。他们描述了网络如何处理缓冲区（机器中的存储区域，用作数据包进出网络的等待区和暂存区）中的拥塞，以及如何从线路和计算机故障中恢复。他们向 ARPA 提供了流程图，概述了 IMP 软件如何处理诸如定时和路由表的持续更新等难题。他们提出了详细的计算、方程式和表格，其中包括传输延迟和数据包排队等。罗伯茨看到了所有这些。

By the time the proposal was finished, it filled two hundred pages and cost BBN more than $100,000, the most the company had ever spent on such a risky project. The BBN team had covered so much of the design of the IMPs that a large fraction of the entire system was already clearly defined. BBN’s finished proposal was more blueprint than outline. Its engineers had designed test programs and regular performance checks for IMPs and the network. They described how the network would handle congestion in the buffers (storage areas in the machines that served as waiting areas and staging areas for the flow of packets into and out of the network), and how it would recover from line and computer failures. They provided ARPA with flowcharts outlining how the IMP software would handle such difficult problems as timing and the continual updating of routing tables. They came up with detailed computations, equations, and tables that covered, among other things, transmission delays and the queueing of packets. It was all there for Roberts to see.

BBN 团队于 1968 年 9 月 6 日提交了提案，他们相对确信没有其他人准备过像他们这样详细的投标书。多年后，当参与 BBN 提案的人员被问及整理文件花了多长时间时，其中一些人诚实地说他们认为花了六个月。

The BBN team submitted its proposal on September 6, 1968, relatively certain that no one else had prepared a bid as detailed as theirs. Years later, when people who worked on the BBN proposal were asked how long it took to put the document together, some of them said honestly they thought it had taken six months.

显然，哈特的团队做了大量额外的基础工作，解决了拉里·罗伯茨没有预料到的一些问题。BBN 还有另一个优势：规模相对较小。罗伯茨不想处理太多官僚主义问题，而其他提案中都充斥着官僚主义。例如，雷神公司提出的团队跨越了五个管理层。罗伯茨知道，光是找到合适的人来讨论最轻微的问题就可能需要打十几个电话。另一方面，BBN 团队的层级结构非常简单。每个人都向哈特汇报，哈特负责分配任务并确保任务完成。哈特有老板，但他似乎给了哈特足够的自由来做他想做的事情。

Heart’s team had obviously done an impressive amount of extra spade work, resolving some problems Larry Roberts hadn’t expected to see covered. BBN held another advantage: its relatively small size. Roberts didn’t want to deal with a lot of bureaucracy, and the other proposals were fraught with it. The team Raytheon was putting forth, for example, spanned five layers of management. Roberts could see that just finding the right person with whom to talk over the slightest problem might require a dozen phone calls. The BBN team, on the other hand, had a very simple hierarchy. Everybody reported to Heart, who handed out the tasks and saw that they got done. Heart had a boss, but he appeared to be giving Heart ample latitude to do as he pleased with this project.

当罗伯茨召开会议审查提案的部分内容时，BBN 的竞标受到了认真对待，这是第一个迹象。哈特、克劳瑟、卡恩和奥恩斯坦兴致勃勃地乘火车前往华盛顿。（哈特试图说服克劳瑟除了运动鞋之外，还要穿点别的鞋，但没有成功。）在会议期间，他们为自己的提案辩护并进行了详尽阐述。罗伯茨测试、督促和鞭策工程师们，看他们是否真的对这个系统进行了深入透彻的思考。他的提问持续了数周。“在某种程度上，我认为拉里不断的提问让我们不断思考问题，并继续在潜意识中完善设计细节，”奥恩斯坦回忆道。“但我认为更重要的是，我们比其他竞争对手更认真对待它。我们将设计视为我们的问题，并尽最大努力寻找我们相信的解决方案，而不会过多地屈从于其他人提出的规范。”

The first sign that BBN’s bid was being taken seriously came when Roberts called a meeting to review parts of the proposal. Heart, Crowther, Kahn, and Ornstein, their spirits high, took the train to Washington. (Heart tried, unsuccessfully, to convince Crowther to wear something on his feet besides sneakers.) During the meeting, they defended and expanded on their proposal. Roberts tested, prodded, and poked the engineers to see if they had really thought deeply and thoroughly about the system. And his questions continued for some weeks afterward. “At some level I think that the continued questioning by Larry kept us thinking about the problems and continuing to fill out design details subliminally,” recalled Ornstein. “But I think the more important thing was that we took it to heart more than the other contenders. We made the design our problem and did our best to find solutions we believed in without bowing too much to the specifications others had put down.”

但大多数时候，他们只能等待。即使罗伯茨有中意的方案，他也不会让任何人知道。他们可能要等上几个月才能得到确切的消息。到了中秋节，他们又回到了马拉松式提案之前所做的事情。时间又慢了下来。克劳瑟去洞穴探险，除了攀岩和写代码，这是他的爱好。哈特在晚餐时间回到家，没有回去工作。卡恩是唯一一个习惯性地工作到深夜的人。每个人都很焦虑。“我个人从确信我们的提案不会被打败，”奥恩斯坦说，“转变为相信我们不可能获胜，因为与其他竞争对手相比，BBN 的规模更大。”

But for the most part, all they could do was wait. If Roberts had a favorite proposal, he wasn’t letting anyone know it. It could take months before they heard anything definite. By midautumn they all returned to what they had been doing before the proposal marathon. Time slowed down again. Crowther went caving, which, next to rock climbing and writing code, was his passion. Heart got home at dinnertime and didn’t go back to work. Kahn was about the only one who, by force of habit, routinely kept working late into the night. Everyone was anxious. “I personally swung from certainty that our proposal couldn’t be beaten,” said Ornstein, “to a belief that there was no way we could win, given the size of BBN compared to the other contenders.”

在整个评估过程中，随着接口信息处理器的竞争逐渐减弱，BBN 团队从 ARPA 小道消息中听到了一些传言，尽管这些传言从未来自罗伯茨本人，他仍然像斯芬克斯一样。自然，他们做了很多事后猜测。在他们比较悲观的时候，BBN 工程师倾向于相信，由于罗伯茨从林肯那里认识了他们中的许多人，因此他可能很难、很尴尬或不可能将合同授予 BBN。尽管如此，ARPA 还是这么做了。

Throughout the evaluation process, as the competition for the Interface Message Processor got whittled down, the BBN team heard rumors through the ARPA grapevine, though never from Roberts himself, who remained sphinxlike. Naturally, they did a lot of second-guessing. In their more pessimistic moments, the BBN engineers were inclined to believe that since Roberts knew many of them from Lincoln, it might be difficult or awkward or impossible for him to award the contract to BBN. Nonetheless, ARPA did just that.

圣诞节前夕，当马萨诸塞州参议员爱德华·肯尼迪的办公室收到消息称，一份价值百万美元的 ARPA 合同被授予一些当地男孩时，肯尼迪发了一封电报，感谢 BBN 的普世努力，并祝贺该公司获得建造“跨信仰信息处理器”的合同。

When news reached Massachusetts Senator Edward Kennedy’s office just before Christmas that a million-dollar ARPA contract had been awarded to some local boys, Kennedy sent a telegram thanking BBN for its ecumenical efforts and congratulating the company on its contract to build the “Interfaith Message Processor.”

4 埋头苦干

4 Head Down in the Bits

1969 年元旦是 Frank Heart 团队最后一次可以休息的时间。接下来的一周，建造第一个接口消息处理器的合同正式开始。BBN 将以略高于 100 万美元的价格建造四个 IMP；第一个将于劳动节前在加州大学洛杉矶分校建成，随后每个月建造一个，一直到 12 月。十二个月后，网络应该可以启动并运行，四个站点将上线。BBN 团队在制定提案时已经做了大量工作。现在展望未来，他们至少还要熬夜加班并进行密集的系统工程工作八个月。仍有许多未知的挑战，BBN 在其提案中着重强调了这一点。此外，Heart 团队的成员对建造 IMP 的难度都有不同的看法。

New Year’s Day, 1969, was the last time Frank Heart’s group would be able to rest for quite a while. The following week, the contract to build the first Interface Message Processors officially began. For a little more than $1 million, BBN would build four IMPs; the first was due at UCLA by Labor Day, followed by one every month through December. In twelve months the network was supposed to be up and running, with four sites on-line. The BBN team had already done a great deal of work in generating the proposal. Now looking ahead, they saw at least eight more months of late nights and intensive systems engineering work. There were still many unknown challenges, a point emphatically underscored by BBN in its proposal. Furthermore, the members of Heart’s team all had different ideas about how difficult building the IMPs would be.

Heart 遇到了许多怀疑论者——主要是电话公司人员和学者——他们不相信分组交换网络会起作用。他们认为，构建硬件并不是真正困难的部分；相反，让所有硬件和软件协同工作——系统部分——才是关键。有人指出，即使你可以集成所有硬件和软件并证明计算机网络的可行性，对于 AT&T 或 IBM 这样的公司来说，这仍然没有任何利润，至少不是一个商业提议。除了少数政府官员或计算机科学家，谁会使用计算机网络？计算不像电视网络或电话公司那样拥有大众市场。

在中标前的几周里，BBN 最大的疑虑是 ARPA 是否会将这项工作委托给这样一家小公司。BBN 团队成员知道现在他们肩负着重任。如果 IMP 不起作用，网络和分组交换将陷入失败实验的遗忘之中。一些人（主要是其他竞标者）对小小的 BBN 赢得合同表示惊讶。“这种大型系统工作似乎不适合 BBN，”一位竞争对手说。

Heart encountered any number of skeptics—phone company people and academicians mostly—who didn’t believe a packet-switching network would work. Building the hardware wasn’t really the hard part, they argued; rather, making it all work together— the systems part—was the trick. Even if you could integrate all the hardware and software and demonstrate the feasibility of a computer network, some pointed out, there still wasn’t any profit in it for a company like AT&T or IBM, not as a business proposition. Who but a few government bureaucrats or computer scientists would ever use a computer network? It wasn’t as if computing had a mass market like the television networks or the phone company.

During the weeks before winning the bid, BBN’s biggest doubt had been whether ARPA would entrust the job to such a small company. The members of BBN’s team knew there was a lot riding on them now. If the IMPs didn’t work, networking and packet-switching would fall into the oblivion of failed experiments. Some people—other bidders mostly— expressed astonishment that little BBN had won the contract. “This kind of large systems job just didn’t seem to be up BBN’s alley,” said one competitor.

总体而言，哈特无视这些批评，尽管他偶尔也会担心未来的技术挑战。为了有效，数据网络必须能够可靠地发送数据包，尽管在通过普通电话线传输时不可避免地会出现错误。人耳可以忍受电话线噪音，这种噪音通常几乎听不见，但接收数据的计算机对噪音非常挑剔，最轻微的嘶嘶声或砰砰声都会破坏少量数据或指令。IMP 必须能够弥补这一缺陷。

By and large, Heart ignored the detractors, although he too worried occasionally about the technical challenges that lay ahead. To be effective, a data network would have to send packets reliably, despite errors unavoidably introduced during transmission over ordinary phone lines. Human ears tolerate telephone line noise, which is often barely audible, but computers receiving data are nit-pickers about noise, and the smallest hiss or pop can destroy small bits of data or instruction. The IMPs would have to be able to compensate.

然后，还有电路中断的可能，特别是如果四节点实验像 ARPA 设想的那样从东海岸扩展到西海岸的话。某个地方的恶劣天气，比如中西部的一场雷暴或新英格兰的一场暴风雪，都会导致承载网络数据流量的长途电话线路服务中断。短暂的服务中断是无法避免的，必须由 IMP 来处理。除此之外，在最好的情况下，还需要解决一系列极其复杂的路由问题。Heart 的团队必须防止消息在网络中无休止地循环，从一个节点跳到另一个节点，而永远无法到达最终目的地。最后，团队必须考虑内存缓冲区发生堵塞的可能性。消息最多可以是 8,000 位；IMP 会将此类消息拆分成一系列数据包，每个数据包的最大大小为 1,000 位。一个数据包将包含相当于本页上大约两行文本的内容。

Then there were circuit outages to anticipate, especially if the four-node experiment expanded coast to coast as ARPA envisioned. A spot of bad weather somewhere, a thunderstorm in the Midwest or a New England blizzard, would knock out service on a long-distance phone line carrying network data traffic. Brief interruptions in service couldn’t be prevented and would have to be dealt with by the IMPs. On top of that, in the best of conditions, there was a vastly complicated matrix of routing problems to be resolved. Heart’s team had to prevent messages from circulating endlessly in the network, bouncing from node to node without ever reaching their final destination. Finally, the team had to consider the possibility of jam-ups in the memory buffers. Messages could be a maximum of 8,000 bits; IMPs were to break such messages into a sequence of packets with a maximum size of 1,000 bits each. One packet would contain the equivalent of about two lines of text on this page.

系统必须在罗伯茨设定的时间规范内传递数据包和消息——消息从任何源主机通过 IMP 子网到达任何目标主机需要半秒钟。这意味着以每秒一百条消息的速度处理数据，这当然是可能的，尽管同步所有内容会很困难。

The system had to deliver packets and messages within the time specifications Roberts had set—half a second for a message to go from any source host to any destination host via the IMP subnet. It would mean processing data at speeds on the order of one hundred messages per second, which was certainly possible although synchronizing everything would be difficult.

似乎技术挑战还不够，ARPA 网络项目进度也非常紧张；罗伯茨设定的进度与预算周期和他在华盛顿面临的政治现实息息相关。八个月的时间不足以让任何人建立完美的网络。每个人都知道这一点。但 BBN 的工作比这更有限；它要证明网络概念是可行的。哈特经验丰富，知道要按时完成如此雄心勃勃的任务，妥协是必要的。尽管如此，哈特的完美主义和他按时完成任务的动力之间始终存在矛盾，有时在别人看来，这是一种公开的、未解决的矛盾。

As if the technical challenges weren’t enough, the ARPA network project schedule was on a fast track; the schedule set by Roberts was tied to the budget cycle and political realities facing him in Washington. Eight months weren’t enough for anyone to build the perfect network. Everyone knew it. But BBN’s job was more limited than that; it was to demonstrate that the network concept could work. Heart was seasoned enough to know that compromises were necessary to get anything this ambitious done on time. Still, the tension between Heart’s perfectionism and his drive to meet deadlines was always with him, and sometimes was apparent to others as an open, unresolved contradiction.

BBN 还面临无数其他问题，导致其他竞标者和潜在竞标者被淘汰。现在，所有这些问题都落在了 Frank Heart 的头上。

入门

Getting Started

“当你把插头插到墙上的插座上，电子就会流动，这是一回事，”鲍勃·卡恩说，“但当你必须弄清楚每个电子的流动方向时，又是另一回事。”在卡恩看来，这概括了构建一个可以动态交换数据包的网络的难度。卡恩对硬件设计知之甚少。他是一名主要从事系统设计和架构概念工作的科学家。由于他对问题的概念性方面思考得可能比他的同事更深入一些，因此他更担心构建网络的复杂性。对卡恩来说，网络更像是一个抽象的概念，可以完善，而且是完整的，而对其他团队成员来说则不然，因为他们参与了网络许多部分的实际编程和布线。

“It’s one thing when you plug into a socket in the wall and electrons flow,” said Bob Kahn. “It’s another thing when you have to figure out, for every electron, which direction it takes.” To Kahn’s way of thinking, this summed up the difficulty of building a network that switched packets of bits, and did so dynamically. Kahn knew very little about hardware design. He was a scientist who mainly did conceptual work on system designs and architecture. Because he pondered the larger conceptual aspects of the problem perhaps a little more deeply than his colleagues, he worried more about the complexity of building the network. To Kahn the network was more of an abstraction, perfectible and whole, than it was to the other team members, involved as they were in the actual programming and wiring of its many parts.

分组交换概念打开了一个丰富的世界，在这个世界中，像卡恩这样理论导向和训练有素的工程师可以研究各种假设场景。卡恩的分析已经帮助塑造了 ARPA 网络项目。卡恩曾向拉里·罗伯茨自由地贡献想法，敦促他使用长途电话线大规模启动 ARPA 网络实验。其他人曾说小规模的实验一开始就很好，但卡恩担心从小规模实验中无法学到任何有意义的东西。罗伯茨同意了，并决定建立一个至少有 19 个节点的跨大陆网络。

The packet-switching concept opened a rich universe in which a theoretically oriented and trained engineer like Kahn could investigate a wide range of hypothetical scenarios. Kahn’s analyses had already helped shape the ARPA network project. Kahn had contributed ideas freely to Larry Roberts, urging him to launch the ARPA networking experiment on a large scale using long-distance telephone lines. Other people had said a small-scale experiment would be fine to begin with, but Kahn had worried that nothing meaningful could be learned from a small experiment. Roberts agreed and decided on a transcontinental network of at least nineteen nodes.

当然，只要你愿意，你完全可以在一个实验室里建立一个网络实验。到那时，唐纳德·戴维斯终于得到了批准和一些资金，可以在伦敦的国家物理实验室进行这项实验，使用短线，每条线最多几百码。卡恩确信小型网络实验不会“扩大规模”，至少在实际意义上不会。他推断，实验室中的短链路不会像电话系统中使用的长线那样具有现实世界的错误率和问题。真正的目标是将计算机科学家，最终是其他计算机用户，跨越全国连接起来。因此，一个真正的网络必须覆盖数千英里，并且必须设计为能够以比任何小型网络高得多的速率处理数据包（并纠正电话线路错误）。

You could certainly build a network experiment in a single laboratory—if you wanted to. By this time Donald Davies had finally been given the go-ahead and some funding to do just that at the National Physical Laboratory in London, using short lines, each hundreds of yards at most. Kahn was sure that a small-network experiment wouldn’t “scale up,” at least not in practical terms. He reasoned that short links in a laboratory wouldn’t have the same real-world error rates and problems as the long lines used in the telephone system. The real goal was to link computer scientists, and eventually other computer users, crosscountry. So a real network would have to cover thousands of miles, and would have to be designed to handle packets—and correct phone-line errors—at a much higher rate than any small network.

罗伯茨似乎信任卡恩的判断。在招标书发布、BBN 成为竞标者之前，两人偶尔会交谈。卡恩被邀请参与 BBN 的提案工作后，他夜以继日地工作到凌晨，有时甚至在塞韦罗·奥恩斯坦的客厅里工作，帮助设计 BBN 竞标的系统。他的努力得到了回报，BBN 赢得了合同，卡恩已经决定圣诞节后重返自己的研究工作。

Roberts seemed to trust Kahn’s judgment. Before the request for proposals hit the streets and BBN became a bidder, the two men spoke occasionally. Once Kahn had been enlisted to contribute to BBN’s proposal effort, he worked into the early-morning hours, night after night, occasionally in Severo Ornstein’s living room, helping to design the system for BBN’s bid. The work paid off, BBN won the contract, and Kahn had already decided to return to his own research work after Christmas.

但随着新年的到来，卡恩开始重新考虑。技术问题很复杂。也许他应该留下来实施。这不会有什么坏处。此外，卡恩渴望从奥恩斯坦那里学到更多关于硬件方面的东西。而转到哈特的商店是卡恩继续自己的网络研究的唯一途径，至少 BBN 的经营者让他这么认为。

But as the new year rolled around, Kahn began to have second thoughts. The technical issues were complicated. Perhaps he should stick around for the implementation. It couldn’t hurt. Besides, Kahn was eager to learn more about the hardware side of things from Ornstein. And moving over to Heart’s shop was the only way for Kahn to continue his own network research, or so the folks who ran BBN led him to believe.

杰瑞·埃尔金德 (Jerry Elkind) 是哈特和卡恩的直属上司，他敦促卡恩加入 IMP 小组，因为哈特现在与 BBN 签订了一份专门负责网络的合同。尽管卡恩继续向埃尔金德汇报，但他还是调到了哈特的系统小组。很快，他就发现自己收拾好办公室，穿过 BBN 人行天桥，从博尔特的学术天堂来到重新设计的仓库，那里有一群自称“IMP 伙计们”的年轻人，他们已经在那里努力工作了。（他们确实是男人。按照当时的惯例，除了哈特的秘书外，设计和建造 ARPA 网络的人都是男性。很少有女性在计算机科学领域任职。哈特的妻子简辞去了林肯大学的编程工作，来抚养他们的三个孩子。）

Jerry Elkind, the man to whom both Heart and Kahn reported, urged Kahn to join the IMP group because Heart now had the one contract at BBN specifically devoted to networking. Although he continued to report to Elkind, Kahn moved into Heart’s systems group. Soon he found himself picking up his office and crossing over the BBN footbridge from Bolt’s scholarly haven into the redesigned warehouse where the group of young men who had started calling themselves the “IMP Guys” were already hard at it. (And guys they were. In keeping with the norms of the time, with the exception of Heart’s secretary, the people who designed and built the ARPA network were all men. Few women held positions in computer science. Heart’s wife, Jane, had quit her programming job at Lincoln to raise their three children.)

Heart 组建的团队知道如何制造出即使不完美，也足够好的东西。他们是工程师和实用主义者。他们一生都在制造东西、连接电线、将概念变为现实。他们的精神是功利主义。从本质上讲，所有工程都归结为在完美和可行之间做出权衡。

The team Heart had assembled knew how to make things that worked, if not perfectly, then well enough. They were engineers and pragmatists. All of their lives they had built things, connected wires, and made concepts real. Their ethos was utilitarian. At its core, all engineering comes down to making tradeoffs between the perfect and the workable.

现在，功能性才是最重要的，而不是优雅或美观。与瑞士高级钟表制造商不同，他们的 40,000 美元手表的工程和艺术是不可分割的，而 Heart 的团队自然而然地将艺术性与制造可靠计算机的工艺分开。低头看零件，自负心更强的次等工程师可能会试图炫耀，将艺术融入机械装置，创造出一些工程奇迹，一个金碧辉煌、精雕细琢的复杂奇迹。Heart 团队的内在力量在于他们的克制和成熟。这里不适合展示标志性工艺。“我们可能犯错的方式有无数种，但也有相当多的方法可以做对，”Heart 签约的第一位程序员 Walden 说。“优秀的工程师总能找到一种正确的方法。”

Functionality mattered now, not elegance or beauty. Unlike, say, fine Swiss watchmakers, whose engineering and art are inseparable in a $40,000 watch, Heart’s team naturally separated artistry from the craft of building a reliable computer. Looking down into the bits, lesser engineers with larger egos might attempt to show off, to infuse the mechanism with art, to create some wonder of engineering, a gold inlaid, filigreed marvel of complexity. The inner strength of Heart’s team was its restraint, its maturity. This was no place for signature craftsmanship. “There was an infinity of ways we could go wrong, and a substantial number of ways to go right,” said Walden, the first programmer Heart had signed on. “Good engineers find one of the ways of going right.”

实时雷达系统、原子弹试验和地震的地震探测系统以及 Heart、Ornstein、Crowther 和 Walden 在林肯实验室研究的其他系统都比 IMP 复杂。多年后，有些人会说 IMP 只不过是一个大型 I/O 设备，实际上非常简单。对于用户来说，IMP 应该像电源插座或墙壁开关一样简单，可以不引人注意地完成工作。不过，将 IMP 打造得像家用插座或开关一样出色且不引人注目正是挑战所在。

The real-time radar systems, the systems for seismic detection of A-bomb tests and earthquakes, and the other systems that Heart, Ornstein, Crowther, and Walden had all worked on at Lincoln Lab had been more complicated than the IMP. Years later, some people would say that the IMP was nothing but a big I/O device and actually very simple. To the user, the IMP was to be as simple as an electrical outlet or a wall switch that does its job without calling attention to itself. Then again, building the IMP to perform as well and as unobtrusively as a household socket or switch was precisely the challenge.

自提案以来，软件团队一直密切合作。每个成员都有特定的角色。Crowther 负责 IMP 到 IMP 的通信，Walden 专注于 IMP 到主机的问题，而 Cosell 负责开发和调试工具。

The software team had been working together closely since the proposal. Each member had a specific role. Crowther worked on IMP-to-IMP communications, Walden concentrated on the IMP-to-host issues, while Cosell worked on development and debugging tools.

32 岁的威利·克劳瑟沉默寡言，但很有主见，他是团队的灵魂人物。1969 年的头几个星期，克劳瑟经常在办公室门框上吊。他周围的每个人都认为这是威利的热身方式。这有助于增强他的攀岩能力，似乎更有助于他的思考。克劳瑟的风格得到了团队其他成员的认可，他表现得好像几天什么都没做，或者只是做了很多门框引体向上，最后才一股脑地释放出脑海中形成的一切。

Willy Crowther, thirty-two years old, quiet but opinionated, was the soul of the team. In the first few weeks of 1969, Crowther did a lot of hanging from office-door frames. Everyone around him just accepted the behavior as Willy’s way of warming up. It helped strengthen his hands for rock climbing and seemed to help his thinking even more. Crowther’s style, recognized by the rest of the team, was to appear as if he were doing nothing for days, or doing just a lot of door-frame chin-ups, before finally releasing in a torrent whatever had been forming in his mind.

如果 Crowther 和他的同事对他们的编程和软件设计充满信心，那么 Ornstein 对指导硬件工作也同样充满信心。他负责设计 BBN 计划添加到 Honeywell 516 中的高速 I/O 设备。他已经在起草提案上投入了大量精力，这是值得的。只需进行一些进一步的改进和收尾工作，团队就可以进入项目的硬件构建和编程阶段。Ornstein 的首要任务是将硬件设计提升到可以向 Honeywell 提供一系列对 516 的详细修改的程度。之后，Honeywell 将开始构建 IMP 与主机和其他 IMP 通信所需的专用 I/O 设备。

If Crowther and his colleagues were confident about their programming and software design, Ornstein was equally confident about directing the hardware effort. He was responsible for designing high-speed I/O devices that BBN planned to add to the Honeywell 516. The considerable effort that he’d already invested in drafting the proposal was time well spent. After making only a few further refinements and finishing touches, the team would be ready to move into the hardware construction and programming phases of the project. Ornstein’s first task was to bring the hardware design to a point where he could go to Honeywell with a set of detailed modifications to the 516. After that, Honeywell would start to build the specialized I/O devices the IMP needed to communicate with the hosts and other IMPs.

IMP 团队必须决定哪些网络操作将由 IMP 软件处理，哪些将由 IMP 硬件硬连线或内置处理。必须快速完成的简单任务最好由硬件处理。但设备一旦设计和制造出来，修改起来就比任何软件都困难。因此，一般来说，IMP 团队更倾向于软件解决方案。如果某件事可以在软件中快速完成，他们就会在软件中完成，设计系统以便以后有更多修改余地。

The IMP team had to decide which network operations would be handled by the IMP software and which would be hardwired, or built into, the IMP hardware. Simple tasks that had to happen quickly were best handled by hardware. But once designed and built, a piece of equipment was harder to modify than any piece of software. So as a rule, the IMP Guys favored software solutions. If something could be done fast enough in software they did it there, designing the system to give themselves more leeway for revisions later on.

到 2 月份，BBN 已与霍尼韦尔签订了购买 DDP-516 的合同。几天之内，霍尼韦尔就在 BBN 莫尔顿街综合大楼前面的房间里交付并安装了第一台 516 计算机。这台机器不是订购的改进型军用级版本，而是一台普通的现成的 516。它是一台测试机，是一台“开发”机，程序员可以在开始工作时使用它进行实验。程序员通常不愿意（或无法）为特定计算机编写代码，直到它运行的实际硬件到位。奥恩斯坦刚刚开始制定专用 I/O 接口的所有最终细节；霍尼韦尔可能还需数周时间才能提供这些接口来进行实验。

By February, BBN had firmed up its contract with Honeywell for the purchase of the DDP-516s. Within days, Honeywell delivered and installed the first 516 computer in a room at the front of BBN’s Moulton Street complex. This machine wasn’t the modified, military-grade version on order but a plain vanilla, off-the-shelf 516. It was a tester, the “development” machine, with which the programmers would experiment as they set to work. Programmers are usually not willing (or able) to go far in writing code for a specific computer until the actual hardware it will run on is at hand. Ornstein had just begun the process of working out all the final details of the specialized I/O interfaces; it might be weeks before Honeywell could make those interfaces available to conduct experiments.

与当时几乎所有的计算机一样，霍尼韦尔的这台机器没有磁盘，没有硬盘，没有软盘（软盘当时还没有发明）。它有一个磁芯存储器，即由细如发丝的铜线和磁化铁氧体环或磁芯组成的密集矩阵，每个磁芯的大小与芥菜籽差不多。订购的内存总大小（12k）以今天的标准来看微不足道。20 世纪 90 年代中期，如果台式计算机的内存由铁氧体磁芯组成，则其面积大约相当于一个足球场。

Like virtually all computers of its era, the Honeywell machine had no disk—no hard drive, no floppy (floppies hadn’t been invented yet). It had a core memory—a dense matrix of hair-thin copper wires and magnetized ferrite rings, or cores, each about the size of a mustard seed. The total size of the memory ordered (12k) was miniscule by today’s standards. The amount of memory in a desktop computer circa mid-1990s, if it consisted of ferrite cores, would take up an area roughly the size of a football field.

核心内存的一个有趣优势是它的非易失性。如果你在处理某件事的过程中关闭机器，它不会丢失它的位置；它会立即从它停止的地方继续。Heart 的团队还设计了一个自动重启功能：如果电源出现故障，机器应该完全停止，然后在电源恢复时自动重新启动。有了核心内存，机器会在电源恢复后立即从程序的开头重新启动。唯一需要重新加载程序的情况是发布新版本或某些硬件或软件故障导致内存被覆盖时。在这些情况下，IMP 程序将从纸带读取器重新加载，纸带读取器是一种笨重的机电设备，它通过拉过一排光电管的纸带将白炽灯泡的光线照射到纸带上。IMP 还有其他自给自足措施，其中之一被称为“看门狗”计时器。 “如果程序失控，”Heart 解释道，机器中的小计时器将运行到零（但正常程序会不断重置它）。如果计时器达到零并响起，则认为 IMP 的程序已损坏。然后它会触发继电器以打开纸带读取器，让其预热一段时间，然后重新加载程序。BBN 会为每台机器配备一份磁带副本，该磁带按顺序包含三个完整的 IMP 操作程序副本，让每个 IMP 有机会在有人必须倒带之前进行三次自动重新加载。后来，BBN 发明了一种更巧妙的方案，从最近的邻居 IMP 重新加载崩溃的 IMP，然后重新开始。这些在当时都是不寻常的功能。

One interesting advantage of core memory is its nonvolatile nature. If you turned the machine off in the middle of working on something, it wouldn’t lose its place; it would pick right back up again where it had left off. Heart’s team had also designed an automatic restart feature: If the power failed, the machine was supposed to come to a clean stop and then restart automatically when power returned. With the core memory, the machine would restart at the beginning of the program as soon as power was restored. The only time a program had to be reloaded was when a new release was issued or when some hardware or software glitch caused the memory to be over-written. In these cases, the IMP program would be reloaded from a paper tape reader, a kludgy electromechanical device which shone light from an incandescent bulb through a paper tape that was pulled across a line of photocells. The IMP had other self-sufficiency measures, one of which was called a “watchdog” timer. “If the program went wild,” Heart explained, a small timer in the machine would run down to zero (but a healthy program would continually reset it). If the timer reached zero and went off, the IMP was assumed to have a trashed program. It would then throw a relay to turn on the paper tape reader, give it a while to warm up, and then reload the program. BBN would ship each machine with a copy of a tape that had three copies of the entire IMP operating program in sequence, giving each IMP the chance to do three auto-reloads before someone had to go and rewind the tape. Later, an even more ingenious scheme would be invented by BBN to reload crashed IMPs from the nearest neighbor IMPs, and start fresh. These were all unusual features at the time.

IMP 小组开始编写代码，等他们写完时，代码大约有六千字。“这是一个很小的程序，”Heart 说。他们用 Honeywell 516“汇编”语言编写了所有程序。

The IMP Guys set to work on writing the code, and by the time they finished, it would turn out to be about six thousand words. “A tiny program,” said Heart. They did all their programming in Honeywell 516 “assembly” language.

计算机是一种遵循指令的机器。汇编语言编程需要思考大量细微步骤，然后编写执行这些步骤的指令。例如，假设你想找到电梯。高级语言中的一组等效指令可能是这样的：“出门，右转，经过喷泉，它就在你的左边。”

Computers are instruction-following mechanisms. Assembly-language programming requires thinking through a vast number of minute steps, then writing the instructions to carry them out. For instance, let’s say you want to find the elevator. An equivalent set of instructions in a high-level language might go something like this: “Go out the door, turn right, go past the water fountain, and it’s on your left.”

汇编语言中的对应语句的开头更像这样：“找到你的左脚；找到你的右脚。将你的左脚放在你的右脚前面。现在将你的右脚放在你的左脚前面。重复此操作十次。停止。向右旋转九十度。”等等。

The equivalent in assembly language would begin more like this: “Find your left foot; find your right foot. Place your left foot in front of your right foot. Now place your right foot in front of your left foot. Repeat this ten times. Stop. Turn ninety degrees to the right.” Etcetera.

用汇编语言编程意味着要疯狂地沉迷于机制。程序员很容易忽视更大的目标，很难编写简短、经济的程序。不熟练的程序员经常会编写出漫无目的的汇编语言程序，就像暴风雪中不幸的北极探险队一样。

To program in assembly language was to dwell maniacally on the mechanism. It was easy for programmers to lose sight of the larger goal and difficult to write short, economical programs. Unskilled programmers often ended up writing assembly-language programs that wandered aimlessly, like some hapless Arctic expedition in a blizzard.

克劳瑟设法在脑子里记住汇编语言编程的详细步骤，而不会迷失方向。但他总是画大流程图，以便能同时想象出一切。一位同事把这个过程比作设计一座整座城市，同时还要跟踪每盏灯的接线和每个厕所的管道。不过，有时克劳瑟会避开流程图，在脑子里画。当其他人努力应用当时基本的编程工具时，克劳瑟却在更高的层次上工作。

Crowther managed to keep the detailed steps of assembly-language programming straight in his head without getting lost. But he was forever drawing big flowcharts so he could picture everything at once. One colleague likened the process to designing a whole city while keeping track of the wiring to each lamp and the plumbing to every toilet. Sometimes, though, Crowther eschewed the flow diagrams and did them in his head. Where others struggled to apply the rudimentary programming tools of the time, Crowther was out there operating on a higher plane.

IMP 软件的编写始于编程团队成员的办公室，每个人都会用 Model 33 电传打字机将代码输入 PDP-1“编辑器”。在 PDP-1 上创建代码后，它会通过纸带传输到霍尼韦尔计算机，然后转换成霍尼韦尔的机器语言，这项工作由一个称为汇编程序的程序处理，该程序将代码转换成 516 可以理解的 1 和 0。然后将汇编代码打到纸带上。有一段时间，程序员尝试使用霍尼韦尔 516 附带的汇编程序，但效率太低，他们很快就放弃了它：Walden 和 Cosell 在一个周末花了 14 个小时来汇编 IMP 系统代码，用掉了几乎一整盒、近半英里长的磁带。

不久之后，Cosell 编写了一些代码来修改走廊尽头 BBN 的分时 PDP-1 计算机上更好的汇编程序。这使得 PDP-1 能够为 Honeywell 516 生成机器语言磁带。从那时起，团队编写了 IMP 代码片段，对其进行了编辑，并在 PDP-1 分时系统下对其进行了汇编。一旦他对汇编过程感到满意，程序员就会指示 PDP-1 将汇编的代码打到纸带上，然后将纸带带回 516 所在的实验室。他会将纸带装入 516，运行它，然后等待观察会发生什么。通常会有一些错误，因此这个过程会重复。自然而然，当其中一位程序员看到在 516 上运行一段新代码时发生了一些有趣或奇怪的事情时，团队成员就会被这件事吸引，并围坐在 Honeywell 周围讨论这件事。

Writing the IMP software began in the offices of the programming team members, where each would type code on a Model 33 Teletype into a PDP-1 “editor.” After the code was created on the PDP-1, it was transferred on paper tape to the Honeywell computer, where it was converted into the Honeywell’s machine language, a chore handled by a program known as an assembler, which converted the code into the 1s and 0s the 516 could understand. The assembled code was then punched onto paper tape. For a while the programmers tried using the assembler that came with the Honeywell 516, but it was so inefficient they soon abandoned it: Walden and Cosell spent fourteen hours one weekend on an assembly of the IMP system code, using almost an entire box, nearly half a mile, of tape.

Not long after that, Cosell wrote some code to modify the much better assembler on BBN’s time-shared PDP-1 computer down the hall. This made it possible for the PDP-1 to produce machine-language tapes for the Honeywell 516. From then on the team wrote pieces of IMP code, edited them, and assembled them under the PDP-1 time-sharing system. Once he was satisfied with an assembly process, the programmer would instruct the PDP-1 to punch out the assembled code on a paper tape, then carry the tape back to the lab where the 516 sat. He would load the tape into the 516, run it, and wait to see what happened. Usually there would be some bugs, and so the process would be repeated. Naturally, when one of the programmers saw something interesting or quirky happening as a new piece of code ran on the 516, the team members would gravitate to the event and stand around the Honeywell talking it over.

大多数 IMP 成员都住在剑桥附近，他们随时都可以方便地进出实验室。厨师 Joyce Chen 最初的中餐馆就在 BBN 隔壁，这对他们经常加班很有帮助。Cosell 和 Walden 喝了很多可乐来保持精力充沛；Crowther 从来不喝可乐。他是个出了名的挑剔的食客（任何超出普通博洛尼亚三明治烹饪水平的东西都是有风险的），这让他成为一个不可能的晚宴嘉宾或用餐伙伴。

Most of the IMP Guys lived close to Cambridge, and it was easy for them to check in and out of the lab at any hour. Chef Joyce Chen’s original Chinese restaurant was next door to BBN, and that helped when they worked late, as they often did. Cosell and Walden drank a lot of Coke to keep themselves going; Crowther never touched the stuff. He was a notoriously finicky eater (anything beyond the culinary level of a plain bologna sandwich was a risk), making him an impossible dinner guest or dining companion.

在项目初期，BBN 被要求向五角大楼的一群高级 ARPA 和军事人员做简报。克劳瑟是代表 IMP 成员计划前往五角大楼的人之一。哈特一想到克劳瑟会穿什么去参加简报会就感到紧张。哈特想，人们肯定会注意到他的脚。人们唯一能记得克劳瑟穿鞋的时候是他结婚那天。哈特去找奥恩斯坦，让他告诉克劳瑟不要穿运动鞋去五角大楼。奥恩斯坦照做了。

Early in the project, BBN was asked to brief a group of high-level ARPA and military personnel at the Pentagon. Crowther was among those planning to make the trip on behalf of the IMP Guys. Heart grew nervous just thinking about what Crowther might wear to the briefing. People were sure to notice his feet, thought Heart. The only time that anyone could remember Crowther wearing shoes you could shine was the day he got married. Heart went to Ornstein and asked him to tell Crowther not to wear sneakers to the Pentagon. Ornstein did.

“威利，弗兰克说你不应该穿着运动鞋来参加这次会议。”

电话那头沉默了许久。然后是克劳瑟平静的声音。“告诉弗兰克，他们之前在 JSAC（联合服务咨询委员会）会议上见过我的运动鞋，没事的。” 确实如此。

There was a long silence at the other end of the line. And then Crowther’s calm voice. “Tell Frank they’ve seen my sneakers in JSAC [Joint Services Advisory Committee] meetings before and it’ll be okay.” It was.

克劳瑟和奥恩斯坦是 Heart 最忠诚的员工之一。但他们喜欢在有机会时取笑老板。“弗兰克对待事情非常非常认真，”奥恩斯坦观察到。

Crowther and Ornstein were among Heart’s most devoted staffers. But they loved to kid the boss when the chance arose. “Frank took things very, very seriously,” Ornstein observed.

奥恩斯坦是越南战争的公开反对者。到 1969 年，许多从未质疑过自己参与五角大楼资助的研究项目的人开始改变主意。奥恩斯坦开始佩戴印有“抵抗”字样的翻领别针。别针上还带有“？”符号，代表电阻，这是电气工程师常用的反战符号。一天，在五角大楼简报会之前，奥恩斯坦想出了一个别针的新用途。在五角大楼开会时，桌子周围的人脱下外套并卷起衬衫袖子并不罕见。奥恩斯坦告诉哈特，他打算趁没人注意的时候将“抵抗”按钮别在将军的外套上。“我想弗兰克其实担心我会这么做，”奥恩斯坦说。（奥恩斯坦没有这样做，但他确实戴着别针参加了会议。）

当 IMP 成员在华盛顿制定计划时，很明显 ARPA 网络将是巴兰和戴维斯最初想法的混合体。 ARPA 网络将使用 IMP 团队自行开发的自适应路由方案，但该方案与 Baran 勾勒的基本思路类似。然而，与 Baran 的理论网络不同，ARPA 网络的冗余级别或与每个节点的链接数量并不相同。BBN 方案中的节点通常与两个相邻节点相连，偶尔与一个或三个相邻节点相连。按照现在的设想，只要两个链接发生故障，就可以将网络划分为孤立的部分。Paul Baran 曾说过，具有大量冗余链接的网络可以用廉价的部件构建；如果某个部件发生故障，还有其他部件可以对其进行备份。ARPA 网络中的低冗余级别更接近 Davies 的计划。Heart 的方法是让网络的每个部分都尽可能地坚固可靠。

Ornstein was an outspoken opponent of the Vietnam War. By 1969 a lot of people who had never questioned their own involvement in Pentagon-sponsored research projects began having second thoughts. Ornstein had taken to wearing a lapel pin that saidRESIST. The pin also bore the ? sign, for electrical resistance, a popular antiwar symbol for electrical engineers. One day, before a Pentagon briefing, Ornstein conceived a new use for his pin. In meetings at the Pentagon, it wasn’t unusual for the men around the table to remove their jackets and roll up their shirt sleeves. Ornstein told Heart that he was going to pin hisRESISTbutton onto a general’s jacket when no one was looking. “I think Frank actually worried that I would,” said Ornstein. (Ornstein didn’t, but he did wear his pin to the meeting.)

As the IMP Guys laid out their plans in Washington, it became apparent that the ARPA network would be a hybrid of the original ideas of Baran and Davies. The ARPA network would use an adaptive routing scheme that the IMP Guys had developed on their own, but which was similar to the basic idea that Baran had sketched. However, unlike Baran’s theoretical network, the ARPA network would not have nearly the same redundancy level or number of links to each node. Nodes in the BBN scheme were normally linked to two neighboring nodes, occasionally to one or three. As it was now conceived, just two failed links could divide, or partition, the network into isolated segments. Paul Baran had said that a network with a multitude of redundant links could be built of inexpensive parts; if a part malfunctioned, there would be others to back it up. The low level of redundancy in the ARPA network was closer to Davies’ plan. Heart’s approach was to make every part of the network as robust and reliable as possible.

在提案期间，Crowther 和 Walden 已经完成了一些非常关键的工作，并取得了惊人的成果。首先，他们找到了一种使自适应路由高效工作的方法。他们还发现，他们可以让系统运行得比任何人想象的都要快得多。观察家说他们的代码行不通；Crowther 和 Walden 知道它会的。在编写他们的程序的“内核”（“非常小的部分，却是唯一重要的东西”，Crowther 说道）时，他们发现，在一个软件程序中，实际上只需要很少的命令就可以将数据包拉入 IMP，确定将它们发送到哪里，并将它们推送到下一行。

During the proposal period, Crowther and Walden had already done some very crucial work, with amazing results. First, they had found a way to make adaptive routing work efficiently. They had also discovered that they could make the system run much faster than anyone imagined. Observers said their code wouldn’t work; Crowther and Walden knew it would. In writing the “kernel” of their program (“the very small part that is the only thing that matters,” as Crowther put it), they had discovered how few commands would actually be needed in a software program to pull packets into the IMP, figure out where to send them, and push them out on the next line.

Crowther 和 Walden 很快就制定出了关键算法，即解决数据包处理和路由问题的基本规则。这让他们下定决心，只需 150 行代码就能通过其中一个 IMP 处理数据包。但由于没有真正的机器来测试，运行代码必须等待。尽管如此，他们还是觉得 IMP 会成功。

Crowther and Walden quickly worked out the critical algorithms—the basic rules for solving the packet-processing and routing problems. That had lead them to the determination that it would take only one hundred fifty lines of code to process a packet through one of the IMPs. But without a real machine to test it on, running the code would have to wait. Nonetheless, they had a good feeling the IMP would work.

让 Heart 担心但又不必处理的关键任务是与 AT&T 签订的分包合同。Larry Roberts 负责在 IMP 准备就绪之前将 50 千比特的线路（每秒能够传输大约两页文本）安排到每个主机站点。Roberts 将这项工作转交给了五角大楼的另一个机构，该机构目前正与 AT&T 合作，商讨安装和租赁适当线路、调制解调器和其他通信设备以形成网络链路的条款。从 IMP 到当地电话局的物理连接将通过普通电话线进行 - 两对双绞铜线包裹在包含大约一千对其他双绞线的电缆中 - 两端都有特殊的终端设备以支持高数据速率。当第一批 IMP 在秋季到达时，专用线路和其他设备将在加利福尼亚站点到位。Heart 知道电话公司将不得不努力履行其义务，他很高兴获得 AT&T 的合作不是他的问题。

A key task that Heart worried about, but didn’t have to handle, was the subcontract with AT&T. It was Larry Roberts’s responsibility to arrange for the 50-kilobit lines (able to transmit about two pages of text per second) into each host site by the date the IMPs were ready. Roberts turned the job over to another Pentagon agency, now working with AT&T on the terms for the installation and leasing of the proper lines, modems, and other communications gear necessary to form links in the network. The physical connection from the IMPs to the local telephone office was to be made by normal telephone wire— two twisted pairs of copper wires wrapped in a cable containing about a thousand other twisted pairs—with special terminating equipment at each end to support the high data rates. The dedicated lines and other equipment were to be in place at the California sites by the time the first IMPs arrived in the fall. Heart knew the telephone company was going to have to scramble to meet its obligations, and he was glad that securing AT&T’s cooperation wasn’t his problem.

罗伯茨是一股冷漠但执着的力量，对该项目至关重要。他的风格是大部分时间都远离首席研究员。每当他投入一个项目时，他从不浪费任何人的时间。他总是坚持自己的观点，然后继续前进。日益壮大的计算机社区的人们开始高度评价罗伯茨。

这是管理 ARPA 信息处理技术办公室的好日子。在泰勒和罗伯茨的领导下，计算研究的预算不断增长，尽管 ARPA 的其他资金因越南战争成本不断上升而被削减。IPTO 的经理们可以把钱花在他们自己选择的优先事项上。如果他们没有得到他们想要的承包商的合作，他们也可以很容易地撤回资金。

Roberts was a distant but persistent force, vital to the project. His style was to stay out of the way of principal investigators most of the time. Whenever he did inject himself into a project, he never wasted anyone’s time. He always made his point and moved on. People in the growing computer community came to regard Roberts highly.

These were great days to be running the Information Processing Techniques Office at ARPA. With Taylor and Roberts there, the budget for computing research kept growing even as the rest of ARPA’s funds were being slashed because of the escalating cost of the Vietnam War. IPTO’s managers could spend money on priorities of their own choosing. And they could just as easily rescind funding if they didn’t receive the kind of cooperation they wanted from contractors.

给予罗伯茨这样的人充分的权力是 ARPA 管理风格的典型特征，这种风格可以追溯到成立初期。这种风格植根于对一线科学家和工程师的深切信任。1969 年，德怀特·艾森豪威尔在临终前向一位朋友询问“我的科学家”，并说他们是“我在华盛顿遇到的为数不多的几个似乎是为了帮助国家而不是为了自己而存在的群体之一”。事实上，包括罗伯茨在内的许多美国最优秀的科学家都认为为该机构工作是一项重要的责任，是一种服务的方式。

Giving ample authority to people like Roberts was typical of ARPA’s management style, which stretched back to its earliest days. It was rooted in a deep trust of frontline scientists and engineers. On his deathbed in 1969, Dwight Eisenhower asked a friend about “my scientists” and said they were “one of the few groups that I encountered in Washington who seemed to be there to help the country and not help themselves.” Indeed, many of the best scientists in the country, Roberts among them, came to view working for the agency as an important responsibility, a way of serving.

但 ARPA 管理人员的薪水并不高。奥恩斯坦曾在一次外地会议上与罗伯茨搭话，看到罗伯茨开着一辆破旧的小型租赁汽车。奥恩斯坦问他为什么要租这么大的车。罗伯茨嘟囔着说奥恩斯坦不懂政府的规则和开支。“我一直以为他把这几百万美元都花光了，”奥恩斯坦说。“我没想到他个人的生活预算其实非常有限。像拉里这样的人为了得到一辆大车，牺牲了自己一段时间。”

But ARPA administrators were not well paid. Ornstein once hooked up with Roberts at an out-of-town meeting and saw Roberts driving a banged-up little rental car. Ornstein asked him why on earth he would rent such a heap. Roberts muttered something about how Ornstein didn’t understand government rules and expenses. “I always thought of him as passing out these millions of dollars,” said Ornstein. “It hadn’t occurred to me that he was in fact living, personally, on quite a limited budget. People like Larry sacrificed themselves for a while in order to get their hands on a big throttle.”

尽管罗伯茨在华盛顿，但他在很多方面都受到了 BBN 团队的待遇。他不常去剑桥，但人们总能感受到他的存在。由于 BBN 只有少数人参与该项目，所以罗伯茨每次来访都会和所有人坐在一起。这些都是关于他们进展的非正式谈话，是冗长的高层非正式会议。作为首席研究员和小组经理，弗兰克·哈特是罗伯茨在 BBN 的主要联系人——但罗伯茨也与卡恩保持着密切联系。

Roberts was treated in most respects as if he were a member of the BBN team, even though he was in Washington. He didn’t travel to Cambridge often, yet his presence was constantly felt. Since only a few people were working on the project at BBN, Roberts sat down with everyone together when he visited. These were informal talks about their progress, lengthy high-level rump sessions. As principal investigator and group manager, Frank Heart was Roberts’s main point of contact at BBN—but Roberts also stayed in close touch with Kahn.

每个站点负责在主机和 IMP 之间构建自定义接口。由于涉及各种品牌的计算机，因此没有一个接口可以适用于所有站点。这需要在每个站点进行单独的硬件和软件开发项目，而主机团队无法在一夜之间完成。

Each site was responsible for building a custom interface between host and IMP. Since computers of various makes were involved, no single interface would do for all the sites. This entailed a separate hardware-and software-development project at each site and was not something the host teams could throw together overnight.

IMP 团队必须先编写主机到 IMP 规范，主机才能开始构建任何东西。Heart 最紧迫的任务是完成 BBN 的主机到 IMP 规范设计，以便 UCLA 的人员能够及时开始工作，满足 Roberts 的时间表。Heart 已经预测到主机站点按时完成工作的难度。他知道首席研究员对研究生的依赖程度有多高，Heart 担心项目可能会因为研究生未能认真对待时间表而脱轨。

The IMP Guys had to write the host-to-IMP specification before the hosts could start building anything. Heart’s most urgent order of business was to complete BBN’s design of the host-to-IMP specification, so people at UCLA could begin working in time to meet Roberts’s schedule. Heart was already predicting difficulty in getting the host sites to complete their work on time. He knew how heavily the principal investigators relied on graduate students, and Heart worried that the project could be derailed because of a graduate student’s failure to treat the schedule seriously enough.

讨论主机到 IMP 规范的时间从几天变成了几周。很明显，除非 Heart 团队中有人承担编写规范的任务，否则将会是空谈而少写。Kahn 主动承担了起草规范的任务，他的同事们也很乐意让他这样做。Heart 认为 Kahn 是团队中最好的作家，所以他退居幕后，让 Kahn 编写了后来被称为 BBN 报告 1822 的规范。

Days spent discussing the host-to-IMP specification turned into weeks. It became obvious that unless someone on Heart’s team seized the task of just writing the specification, there would be more talk and little writing. Kahn took it upon himself to draft the specification, and his colleagues were happy to let him. Heart thought Kahn was the best writer the group had, so he stood back and let Kahn produce the specification that became known as BBN Report 1822.

有些人认为 Heart 过于担心潜在的工程故障。在工程方面，他是一位最谨慎的司机。Heart 很早就从林肯实验室的导师、磁芯存储器的发明者 Jay Forrester 那里学到了谨慎的工程学。Forrester 向整整一代麻省理工学院的工程师灌输了可靠性的概念。可靠性是他们的首要任务，比成本、性能或其他任何东西都重要 — 为可靠性而设计、为可靠性而制造、为最坏的情况做准备，最重要的是，不要让你的机器处于故障的境地。Heart 的口号从一开始就以千种方式将可靠性融入 IMP。

Some people thought Heart worried excessively about potential engineering failures. He was a most defensive driver when it came to engineering. Heart had learned cautious engineering early on from his mentor at Lincoln Lab, Jay Forrester, the inventor of core memory. Forrester had drummed reliability into the heads of a whole generation of MIT engineers. Above cost, performance, or anything else, reliability was their top priority— design for it, build for it, prepare for the worst, and above all, don’t put your machine in a position to fail. Heart’s mantra built reliability into the IMP in a thousand ways right from the start.

众所周知，计算机制造商为了在价格上竞争并按时制造新机器，会偷工减料。他们几乎总是以更高的故障率（错误和计算机崩溃）为代价，但通常不会损害声誉。从罗伯茨到哈特，所有 IMP 成员都希望这个项目有更高的标准。全天 24 小时运行的网络需要 BBN 制造的 IMP 具有稳定的性能。公认的要求是 IMP 会尽最大努力准确传递每一条消息。一条线路可能会发生故障，甚至主机也可能会发生故障，但 IMP 不应该发生故障。从某种意义上说，可靠性是网络的基本原则。ARPA 网络将始终体现弗兰克·哈特的稳重性格。

Computer manufacturers were known to cut corners in order to compete on price and build new machines on time. They almost always paid some price in terms of higher failure rates—bugs and computer crashes—but usually it didn’t ruin reputations. From Roberts to Heart, on down the line, all of the IMP Guys expected a higher standard in this project. A network running twenty-four hours a day would demand solid performance from the BBN-built IMPs. The accepted imperative was that the IMPs would do their best to deliver each and every message accurately. A line might fail, even a host machine might fail, but the IMPs should not. Reliability was, in a sense, the founding principle of the network. The ARPA network would always reflect Frank Heart’s own steady character.

奥恩斯坦以严厉的监督员而闻名，他是一名非常高效的技术审查员。他的招牌台词是：“我只是一个愚蠢的硬件专家，说服我！”他不会放手，直到解释对他来说有意义。他经常发现一些隐藏的弱点。

Ornstein had a reputation as a hard taskmaster, and he was very effective as a technical examiner. His trademark line was, “I’m just a dumb hardware guy, convince me!” He wouldn’t let go until the explanation made sense to him. Often he uncovered some hidden soft spot.

BBN 的许多规划会议都在 Weiner 会议室举行，这是一间天花板很高的会议室，里面有一张大方桌和许多黑板。它位于 BBN 系统部门中间的走廊交叉口，是 516 计算机室、午餐室和 Heart 办公室的十字路口，位置便利。Weiner 会议室是 IMP 成员的定期聚会场所。IMP 团队规模很小，他们的办公室很近，团队成员之间的联系很频繁，因此不需要正式的设计评审。他们在走廊上交谈，坐在彼此的办公室里，辩论并不断分享想法。在 Weiner 会议室，人们经常用粉笔写字，解释、绘制图表、概述、辩论和教学。Ornstein 用这个房间举办了一系列非正式的讲座，详细解释了软件和硬件，偶尔也会有访客进来谈论技术主题。整个团队共享信息。“每个人都知道一切”，正如 Crowther 所说。

Many of the planning sessions at BBN took place in the Weiner Room, a high-ceilinged conference room with a big square table and plenty of chalkboards. It was conveniently located at an intersection of corridors in the middle of BBN’s systems division, a crossroads between the 516 computer room, the lunchroom, and Heart’s office. The Weiner Room served as a regular gathering place for the IMP Guys. The IMP team was small enough, their offices close enough, and contact among team members frequent enough that formal design reviews were unnecessary. They talked in the hallways, sat in one another’s offices, debated, and shared ideas constantly. In the Weiner Room, chalk was applied liberally and often to explain, diagram, outline, argue, and teach. Ornstein used the room to hold an informal lecture series, in which software and hardware were explained in detail, and occasionally visitors would come in to talk about technical subjects. The whole team shared information. “Everybody knew everything,” as Crowther put it.

团队成员还撰写了一系列非正式的技术笔记，并在他们之间传阅。这些笔记没有严格的格式，但总是以“IMP 成员的笔记”开头。他们写下自己的想法，交换想法，然后通常聚在一起讨论。这些笔记也让 Heart 可以监控他们的进度。

The team members also wrote a numbered series of informal technical notes that they circulated among themselves. The notes didn’t have a strict format but always began “The IMP Guys’Notes.” They wrote down their ideas, exchanged them, and then usually got together to discuss them. The notes also gave Heart a way of monitoring their progress.

Heart 对工作成熟后的评审与传统的设计评审完全不同。设计评审通常是工程项目过程中的一件大事。工程团队可能需要数周时间准备评审设计，然后聚在一起提交、阐述并在同事和高级工程师的监督下进行辩论。Heart 的评审往往是临时性的和持续性的，这并不是说评审很容易。“这就像是一个拥有通灵能力的人对你进行口试，这就像一场最可怕的噩梦，”团队的王牌软件故障排除员 Bernie Cosell 回忆道。“他可以凭直觉知道设计中你最不确定的部分、你最不了解的地方、你只是在唱歌跳舞、试图蒙混过关的领域，并把令人不快的聚光灯投在你最不想处理的部分上，同时几乎忽略了你为自己真正完成并正确完成而感到自豪的部分。”

Heart’s reviews of the work as it matured were nothing like traditional design reviews. A design review is usually a major event in the course of an engineering project. An engineering team may work for weeks preparing a design for review, then come together to submit, elaborate on, and debate it under the scrutiny of colleagues and senior engineers. Heart’s reviews tended to be ad hoc and ongoing, which isn’t to say that they were easy. “It was like your worst nightmare for an oral exam by someone with psychic abilities,” recalled Bernie Cosell, the team’s ace software troubleshooter. “He could intuit the parts of the design you were least sure of, the places you understood least well, the areas where you were just song-and-dancing, trying to get by, and cast an uncomfortable spotlight on parts you least wanted to work on, meanwhile virtually ignoring the parts you were so proud of for having gotten really nailed down and done right.”

科塞尔说，就像与罗伯茨不经常见面一样，Heart 的设计评审旨在“帮助解决困难部分”。Heart 对他的工程师所做的工作非常尊重。但他很少表扬他。他的态度似乎是，为什么要浪费时间呢？年轻和经验不足的工程师可能会因为 Heart 缺乏积极反馈而感到沮丧，但 IMP 成员是一群经验丰富、团结一致、自信的人，他们已经习惯了 Heart 的做事方式。

Like the less-frequent meetings with Roberts, Heart’s design reviews were meant “to help thrash through the hard parts,” Cosell said. Heart had implicit respect for the things his engineers did that worked well. But he was sparing with his praise. His attitude seemed to be, Why waste time with that? Younger and less experienced engineers might have been devastated by the lack of positive feedback from Heart, but the IMP Guys were a seasoned, closely knit, self-assured bunch well accustomed to Heart’s ways.

由于 Heart 坚持可靠性，以及 Kahn 早期对该领域的分析，大量的错误控制机制被设计到系统中。每个通信系统都容易因通信电路中的噪声而出现传输错误。通过电话（一种模拟传输）传输的声音可能会出现混乱或含糊不清的情况，例如“s”和“f”的发音混淆。数字传输也会出现失真：“1”可能会被误认为“0”，反之亦然。错误会突发发生。如果某个位出现错误，则周围位出现错误的概率会比正常情况高得多。尽管存在这些问题，但仍有很好的技术可以检测甚至纠正数字错误，而 IMP 必须依赖这些技术。

Because of Heart’s insistence on reliability, and Kahn’s early analysis of this area, a large number of error-control mechanisms were designed into the system. Every communications system is prone to errors in transmission caused by noise in the communication circuits. Voices passing through telephones, an analog transmission, can be garbled or ambiguous—as when the sounds of “s” and “f” are confused. Digital transmissions can also be distorted: a “1” can come through as a “0” and vice versa. Errors occur in bursts. If a given bit is in error, the probability of surrounding bits being in error is much higher than normal. Despite these problems, there are good techniques for detecting and even correcting digital errors, and the IMPs would have to rely on them.

数字纠错基于“校验和”的基本思想，校验和是一个相对较小的数字，它根据源数据计算出来，然后与数据一起传输，并在目的地重新计算。如果原始数字和重新计算的数字不一致，则传输中存在错误，除非校验硬件本身出现故障，但这种情况不太可能发生。

Digital error correction rests upon the basic idea of the “checksum,” a relatively small number that is calculated from the data at its source, then transmitted along with the data, and recalculated at the destination. If the original and recalculated numbers do not agree, there has been an error in the transmission, unless perhaps the checking hardware itself failed, a very unlikely proposition.

校验和出现在各种数据传输中。例如，超市收银台的每一次哔哔声都表明一台微型激光器扫描了条形码并将其数字传输到计算机，计算机计算出校验和并发现其正确无误。收银台的机器在此过程中进行了一些复杂的十进制运算，将扫描的数字进行打乱、乘法和加法 — 所有这些都在眨眼间完成。在大多数超市系统中，结果必须以 0 结尾，这是用于所有产品的个位数校验和。

Checksums appear in data transmissions of all kinds. For instance, every beep you hear at the supermarket checkout counter signifies that a tiny laser has scanned a bar code and transmitted its digits to a computer where the checksum has been calculated and found to be correct. The machine at the checkout counter has done some sophisticated decimal arithmetic along the way by shuffling, multiplying, and adding the scanned digits—all in the blink of an eye. In most supermarket systems the result must end in 0, the single-digit checksum used for all products.

如果扫描产品后计算机没有发出蜂鸣声，则说明算法没有通过。如果计算机有纠正错误的方法，它会在每次扫描时发出蜂鸣声，从而节省时间。但纠错技术会增加系统成本，因此收银员必须再次将商品通过扫描仪，可能要重复两三次，直到代码传输无误。

If a product is scanned and the computer fails to beep, it means the arithmetic didn’t check. If the computer had a way of correcting the error, it would beep on every pass and save time. But error-correcting techniques add cost to the system, so the checkout person must pass the item through the scanner again, perhaps two or three times until the code is transmitted without error.

IMP 团队面临类似的问题：如果校验和检测到网络上的数据包错误，应该如何处理？发送方 IMP 是否应该再次发送数据包，还是接收方 IMP 应该使用硬件来纠正错误？在网络中，纠错会占用通信电路的空间，并增加交换设备的硬件成本。因此，BBN 团队决定，如果 IMP 检测到数据包中的错误，它将丢弃该数据包而不确认收到。源 IMP 仍拥有重复的数据包，仍在等待确认但未收到确认，因此将重新传输重复的数据包。

The IMP Guys faced a similar problem: If a checksum detected a packet error on the network, how should it be handled? Should the transmitting IMP send the packet again, or should the receiving IMP be augmented with hardware to correct the error? In a network, error correction eats up space on the communications circuits and increases hardware expense in the switching equipment. Consequently, the BBN team decided that if an IMP detected an error in a packet, it would discard the packet without acknowledging receipt. The source IMP, still possessing a duplicate packet and still awaiting acknowledgment but not getting it, would then retransmit the duplicate.

在发布提案请求之前，罗伯茨必须决定 IMP 的校验和类型。应该为其分配多少位，以及它应该有多复杂？精确的要求基于电话线路中的平均错误数，很难确定，因为没有关于要发送数据的高速线路上的错误率的确切信息。不过，很明显，1 位校验和永远不行。2 位也不行，甚至 8 位也不行。即使是 16 位校验和也可能不够好。

Before issuing the request for proposals, Roberts had had to decide on the type of checksum for the IMPs. How many bits should be assigned to it and how sophisticated should it be? The precise requirement, based on an average number of errors in the phone lines, was difficult to determine because there was no hard information available about error rates on the high-speed lines over which the data was to be sent. Still, it was obvious that a 1-bit checksum would never do. Nor would a 2-bit, or even an 8-bit. Even a 16-bit checksum might not be good enough.

Kahn 之前曾证明，16 位校验和可能不足以达到网络所需的可靠性水平，尤其是考虑到高速线路的错误性能存在不确定性。Kahn 与 Roberts 分享了一些粗略的计算，这些计算强烈建议 24 位校验和是更好的选择，并指出额外的 8 位对硬件的开销很小。校验和指出额外的 8 位对硬件的开销很小。校验和位校验和被写入 RFP。后来，Kahn 向 Crowther 和其他人令人信服地论证了同样的论点，IMP Guys 决定将 24 位校验和作为错误控制系统的一个重要组成部分。

Kahn had earlier documented that a 16-bit checksum might not be sufficiently powerful to reach the desired level of reliability in the network, especially given the uncertainty in error performance of the high-speed lines. Kahn shared with Roberts some rough calculations that strongly suggested a 24-bit checksum would be a much better choice, pointing out that the extra 8 bits added very little expense to the hardware. The checksum pointing out that the extra 8 bits added very little expense to the hardware. The checksum bit checksum got written into the RFP. Later, Kahn argued the same case convincingly to Crowther and the others, and the IMP Guys settled on the 24-bit checksum as one vital piece of the error-control system.

BBN 工程师对哪些问题需要用硬件解决、哪些问题需要用软件解决有着敏锐的直觉。让 IMP 的硬件计算校验和是明智之举，因为软件计算速度太慢。最终的 IMP-to-IMP 错误检测方案巧妙地结合了已知的工程技术以及 BBN 团队自己发明的其他技术。正如 Crowther 所说，“我们会从任何地方窃取想法，但大多数时候我们必须自己动手。”

The BBN engineers had good intuition for which problems to solve in hardware and which ones to solve in software. It made sense to let the IMP’s hardware calculate the checksum, because a software calculation would be too slow. The final IMP-to-IMP error-detection scheme was a clever mix of known engineering techniques and others of the BBN team’s own invention. As Crowther put it, “We’d steal ideas from anywhere, but most of the time we had to roll our own.”

1969 年情人节那天，剑桥被暴风雪笼罩。大约有二十几个人参加了在 BBN 举行的全天会议。这是 Heart 团队与来自主办地的研究人员和研究生的第一次会面。

On Valentine’s Day 1969, Cambridge was socked in by a snowstorm. About two dozen people were in attendance at an all-day meeting at BBN. This was the first meeting between Heart’s team and the researchers and graduate students from the host sites.

在哈特谨慎的眼中，这群以研究生为主的人群似乎渴望得到 IMP。他怀疑，当 ARPA 决定将 IMP 放在现场时，研究人员希望有另一台计算机可以玩。他想象他们会想用 IMP 做各种其他事情——下棋或计算所得税。“我采取了非常严格的立场，”哈特回忆道。“他们不能触摸它，不能靠近它，几乎不能看它。它是一个封闭的盒子，没有可用的开关。”

Through Heart’s cautious eyes, this crowd of mostly graduate students looked hungry to get their hands on the IMPs. He suspected that when ARPA decided to put the IMPs out at the sites, the researchers expected to have another computer to play with. He imagined they’d want to use the IMPs for all sorts of other things—to play chess or calculate their income taxes. “I took an extraordinarily rigid position,” Heart recalled. “They were not to touch, they weren’t to go near it, they were to barely look at it. It was a closed box with no switches available.”

Kahn 仍在努力制定主机到 IMP 接口规范，因此主机团队成员仍不清楚他们到底需要构建什么。一些主机站点的人询问 BBN 的想法，但 IMP 成员之间尚未达成一致。会议上没有就这个问题达成任何共识。

Kahn was still hard at work on the host-to-IMP interface specification, so it remained unclear to host team members exactly what they’d be required to build. Some people from the host sites asked to see what BBN had in mind, but the IMP Guys hadn’t settled on a plan among themselves. On that issue nothing much was resolved at the meeting.

研究生们决定与 BBN 分享他们为主机计算端到端校验和而设计的计划。这将为主机到主机通信中的错误提供额外的保护。它旨在捕获各种想象中的错误，包括 IMP 可能错误组装的消息包。

The graduate students decided to share with BBN a plan they had devised for the hosts to compute an end-to-end checksum. This would provide an extra layer of protection against errors in host-to-host communications. It was designed to catch various imagined errors, including the possible misassembly of message packets by the IMPs.

Heart 听到这个消息很苦恼，因为这会降低主机的速度，使整个系统看起来很慢。IMP 可能会将损坏的数据包传递给主机，这一想法也让他很不舒服。学生们认为，BBN 的 24 位校验和没有涵盖从 IMP 到主机的路径，并且位在两台机器之间“裸露”传输。Heart 毫不含糊地向所有人保证，IMP 校验和是可靠的。这还有待观察，随着时间的推移，学生们的正确率会高于错误率，但随着 Heart 信心的展现，主机站点放弃了在主机协议中包含校验和的计划。

Heart was distressed to hear this, because it would slow down the hosts and make the entire system appear slow. Nor did the very idea that the IMPs might pass damaged packets up to the hosts sit well with him. The students argued that BBN’s 24-bit checksum didn’t cover the paths from the IMPs to the host computers, and that bits traveled “naked” between the two machines. Heart assured everyone, in no uncertain terms, that the IMP checksum would be reliable. It remained to be seen, and in time the students would be more right than wrong, but with Heart’s confidence on display, the host sites dropped their plans to include a checksum in the host protocols.

更成问题的是将多台主机连接到每个站点的 IMP 的想法。当罗伯茨最初设计网络时，他的想法是将一台（且仅一台）主机连接到每个 IMP。然而，到情人节会议时，各站点的代表明确表示，他们希望将多台主机连接到每个 IMP。每个研究中心都有多台计算机，如果可能的话，尝试在每个站点连接多台机器是有意义的。罗伯茨向剑桥传话说，BBN 将重新设计 IMP，使其每台最多可处理四台主机。沃尔登、克劳瑟和科塞尔发明了一种巧妙的方法来实现这一点。

More problematic was the idea of connecting multiple host computers to the IMP at each site. When Roberts first designed the network, his idea was to connect one—and only one—host computer to each IMP. However, by the Valentine’s Day meeting, representatives from the sites were making it clear that they wanted to connect more than one host computer to each IMP. Every research center had multiple computers, and it made sense to try to connect more than one machine per site, if possible. Roberts sent word to Cambridge that BBN was to redesign the IMP to handle up to four hosts apiece. Walden, Crowther, and Cosell invented a clever way to do it.

情人节过后，IMP 成员们开始真正投入工作。他们的工作时间一直持续到深夜。住在林肯乡村小镇的 Heart 试图及时回家吃晚饭，但经常赶不上。其他人回家吃晚饭然后继续工作，或者干脆不回家，这样更方便。当 Crowther 全身心投入到项目中时，他会坐在终端机前，直到睡着。

After Valentine’s Day, the IMP Guys really went to work. Their working hours stretched long into the night. Heart, who lived in the rural town of Lincoln, tried to get home in time to have dinner, but often he didn’t make it. It was easier for the others to go home for dinner and return to work, or not go home at all. When he was deep into the project, Crowther would sit at his terminal until he fell asleep.

现在，真正的压力落在了 Kahn 身上。接下来的两个月里，他大部分时间都在和主机站点的人员通电话，努力制定接口规范。Kahn 成为 BBN 与主机研究社区的主要联系人。研究人员经常打电话给他，询问正在发生的事情和时间表，或者只是传达新的想法。

Now the real pressure was on Kahn. He spent much of the next two months on the phone with people at the host sites, grinding away at the interface specification. Kahn became BBN’s main point of contact with the host research community. Researchers called him regularly to check what was happening, and what the schedule was, or simply to pass along new ideas.

到 4 月中旬，Kahn 完成了规范，这是一份厚厚的文档，描述了主机应如何与分组交换机 (IMP) 通信。“编写规范时，我们一方面考虑到了主机的需求，另一方面也考虑到了哪些是可以实现的，哪些对我们来说是有意义的，”Walden 说。主机站点代表委员会审查了规范，并告诉 BBN 他们认为哪些地方行不通。规范经过修改，直到设计出可接受的方案。主机站点现在有东西要建造了。UCLA 团队将是第一个，他们只有不到五个月的时间来为 IMP 的到来做好准备。

By mid-April, Kahn finished the specification, a thick document describing how a host computer should communicate with a packet switch, or IMP. “It had been written partly keeping in mind what we’d been told the hosts wanted, and quite a lot keeping in mind what was going to be possible to implement, and what made sense to us,” said Walden. A committee of representatives of the host sites reviewed it and told BBN where they didn’t think it would work. The specification was revised until an acceptable design was reached. The host sites had something to build now. The UCLA team, which would be first, had less than five months to get ready for the arrival of its IMP.

Heart 在 IMP 处理的内容和主机处理的内容之间划出了一条清晰的界线。“很早以前，Frank 就做出了一个非常明智的决定，即在主机职责和网络职责之间划出一条清晰的界线，”Crowther 说。Heart 和他的团队决定在 IMP 和主机之间建立“最大限度的逻辑分离”。从概念和设计上讲，划出这条界线是合理的，可以避免 IMP 的功能变得混乱或拥挤。这也使得 IMP 的构建更易于管理。所有 IMP 都可以设计成相同的，而不是针对每个站点进行定制。这也使 BBN 不会陷入中间，而不得不通过网络协议在主机站点之间进行调解。

Heart had drawn a clear line between what the IMPs would handle and what the hosts would do. “Early on, Frank made a decision, a very wise decision, to make a clean boundary between the host responsibilities and the network responsibilities,” said Crowther. Heart and his team decided to put “maximum logical separation” between the IMP and the host. It made conceptual and design sense for them to draw the line there to avoid cluttering or crowding the IMP’s functions. This also made building the IMPs more manageable. All IMPs could be designed the same, rather than being customized for each site. It also kept BBN from being caught in the middle, having to mediate among the host sites over the network protocols.

BBN 同意罗伯茨的观点，认为 IMP 不会执行任何主机到主机的功能。这是一个很大的技术问题。既没有语言标准，也没有字长标准，到目前为止，还没有任何东西可以方便主机之间的通信。即使是像 Digital 这样的个别制造商，也制造了许多完全不兼容的计算机。

BBN had agreed with Roberts that the IMPs wouldn’t perform any host-to-host functions. That was a large technical problem. There were neither language standards nor wordlength standards, and so far nothing that would facilitate easy communication between hosts. Even individual manufacturers, such as Digital, built a number of wholly incompatible computers.

BBN 最不希望遇到的就是解决主机到主机问题的额外麻烦。此外，罗伯茨不想让 BBN 或任何其他承包商对网络设计有太多控制权。罗伯茨决心平均分配责任。罗伯茨和 BBN 之间达成了一致：IMP 将被构建为一个信使，一个复杂的存储转发设备，仅此而已。它的工作是携带位、数据包和消息：分解消息、存储数据包、检查错误、路由数据包，并发送无错误到达数据包的确认；然后将传入的数据包重新组装成消息并将它们发送到主机 — 所有这些都使用一种通用语言。

The last thing BBN wanted was the additional headache of solving the host-to-host problems. Furthermore, Roberts didn’t want to give BBN or any other contractor that much control over the network design. Roberts was determined to distribute responsibilities evenly. Between Roberts and BBN it was settled: The IMP would be built as a messenger, a sophisticated store-and-forward device, nothing more. Its job would be to carry bits, packets, and messages: To disassemble messages, store packets, check for errors, route the packets, and send acknowledgments for packets arriving error-free; and then to reassemble incoming packets into messages and send them up to the host machines—all in a common language.

IMP 被设计为只读取每条消息的前 32 位。消息的这一部分最初称为“引导符”（后来改为“标头”），指定源或目标，并包含一些额外的控制信息。引导符包含发送和处理消息所需的最少数据。然后，这些消息在源 IMP 内被分解成数据包。读取消息内容的负担将由主机本身承担。

The IMPs were designed to read only the first 32 bits of each message. This part of the message, originally called a “leader” (and later changed to “header”), specified either the source or destination, and included some additional control information. The leader contained the minimal data needed to send and process a message. These messages were then broken into packets within the source IMP. The burden of reading the content of the messages would be on the hosts themselves.

主机计算机使用多种不同的语言，而使网络发挥作用的最困难部分是让主机相互通信。主机站点必须让不同的计算机通过他们事先商定的协议相互通信。在 ARPA 的推动下，主机社区正在有组织地努力开始解决这些协议问题，尽管他们知道要花很长时间才能最终解决问题。

The host computers spoke many different languages, and the hardest part of making the network useful was going to be getting the hosts to communicate with each other. The host sites would have to get their disparate computers to talk to each other by means of protocols they agreed on in advance. Spurred by ARPA, the host community was making an organized effort to begin resolving those protocol issues, knowing it would be quite a while before anything was settled definitively.

IMP 编号 0

IMP Number 0

一个春日，一辆霍尼韦尔的送货卡车驶入莫尔顿街。车内是第一台按照 BBN 规格制造的 516 机器。这台冰箱大小的计算机从卡车上下来，被运到系统部门大楼后面的装卸码头，然后被推入码头旁边的一个大房间，不久后被称为 IMP 室。该团队通过增加高架计算机地板、明亮的荧光灯和空调，将一个储藏室改造成测试 IMP 的空间。这个没有窗户的房间是团队中最年轻的人，22 岁的本·巴克，很快就会花很多时间的地方。

One spring day, a delivery truck from Honeywell turned down Moulton Street. Inside was the first 516 machine built to BBN’s specifications. The refrigerator-sized computer was brought off the truck and onto a loading dock at the back of the systems division building and then was rolled into a large room, soon to be known as the IMP room, adjacent to the dock. The team had converted a storeroom into space for testing the IMPs by adding a raised computer floor, bright fluorescent lighting, and air-conditioning. The windowless room was where the youngest man on the team, twenty-two-year-old Ben Barker, would soon spend a lot of time.

巴克是一名本科生，在哈佛教授的一门课上，他的才华引起了奥恩斯坦的注意。当 BBN 获得 ARPA 合同时，Heart 为巴克提供了一份工作，巴克请了假接受了这份工作。巴克和奥恩斯坦一样，也是一名硬件工程师，他有成为王牌调试员的迹象——能够在必要时挽救项目的人。他负责安装霍尼韦尔交付的每个 IMP，并在硬件离开 BBN 商店之前对其进行调试。

Barker was an undergraduate student whose brilliance had caught Ornstein’s attention in one of the classes he taught at Harvard. When BBN was awarded the ARPA contract, Heart had offered Barker a job, and Barker had taken a leave of absence to accept it. Barker, like Ornstein, was a hardware engineer and he showed signs of becoming an ace debugger—someone who could rescue a project when the time came. He was placed in charge of setting up each IMP Honeywell delivered and debugging the hardware before it left BBN’s shop.

第一台机器是原型机（IMP 编号 0），是一台非加固型 516，包含霍尼韦尔对 BBN 接口的初始实现。Barker 将机器放在房间中间，接通计算机电源，插上所有电源，然后打开它。

This first machine was the prototype (IMP Number 0), a nonruggedized 516 containing Honeywell’s initial implementation of BBN’s interfaces. With the machine in the middle of the room, Barker ran power to the computer, plugged everything in, and turned it on.

巴克已经制作了一个测试器，并编写了一些调试代码。他期待着解决机器存在的任何错误。毫无疑问，有些东西需要修复，因为总是有错误；错误是计算机设计自然过程的一部分。哈特和整个团队期待着找出 IMP 设计的哪些部分有效，哪些部分需要更多关注。

Barker had built a tester and had written some debugging code. He was looking forward to working out whatever bugs the machine had. Undoubtedly there would be something that would need fixing, because there always was; bugs were part of the natural process of computer design. Heart and the whole team looked forward to finding out which parts of the IMP design worked and which needed more attention.

巴克尝试将第一个 IMP 诊断程序加载到未经测试的机器中。他无法让它工作。因此，他加载了一些其他代码，但也没有用。巴克尝试了其他一些方法，发现什么都不起作用。“这台机器根本做不到任何有用的事情，”他说。到目前为止，第一个 IMP 是一个失败品。

Barker tried loading the first IMP diagnostic program into the untested machine. He couldn’t get it to work. So he loaded some other code, and that didn’t work either. Barker tried a few other things and discovered that nothing worked. “The machine didn’t come close to doing anything useful,” he said. So far, the first IMP was a fizzling dud.

在 IMP 项目之前，BBN 和霍尼韦尔的员工交流很随意，关系也很好。在 IMP 项目开始前，双方的团队合作意识逐渐增强。霍尼韦尔从第一天起就派出了一个专门的系统团队来负责 BBN 合同的工作。应 BBN 的要求，霍尼韦尔专门指派了一名技术人员负责指导霍尼韦尔部分的工作完成。

Prior to the IMP project, people at BBN and Honeywell had interacted casually and relations were friendly. In the days leading up to the IMP project a sense of teamwork grew. Honeywell had devoted a special systems crew to work on the BBN contract from day one. At BBN’s request, Honeywell had assigned one of its technicians exclusively to the task of shepherding Honeywell’s part of the job to completion.

这很不寻常。一般来说，像霍尼韦尔这样的小型计算机制造商并不太迎合客户的特殊需求。“大多数计算机公司根本不会制造特殊产品，”哈特说。“或者如果他们这么做，那也是迫于压力。”小型计算机销售人员追逐的是广阔的市场，而大型计算机制造商则以对待客户如皇室般尊贵而闻名。小型计算机行业中没有人会提供太多指导。

This was unusual. In general, minicomputer manufacturers like Honeywell didn’t cater much to the special demands of their customers. “Most computer companies won’t build specials at all,” said Heart. “Or if they do, it’s under great duress.” Minicomputer salespeople went after a broad market, while mainframe computer makers were known to treat customers like royalty. Nobody in the minicomputer business did much handholding.

在 IMP Number 0 彻底失败之后，BBN 的硬件主管 Ornstein 开始与霍尼韦尔团队一起研究设计。他发现霍尼韦尔似乎没有人详细了解 BBN 设计的接口应该如何工作。他惊讶地发现，建造第一个接口的技术人员并不真正理解图纸。霍尼韦尔没有尝试开发任何诊断程序来测试设计；它只是试图忠实地实现 Ornstein 绘制的框图，BBN 已将其包含在向 ARPA 提出的提案中。问题是，在向霍尼韦尔提供一套相当通用的框图时，BBN 认为霍尼韦尔对自己机器的熟悉和专业知识将使这家计算机制造商能够预见到 BBN 要求对 516 型进行修改时可能出现的任何特殊问题。霍尼韦尔有自己的逻辑模块，自己的设计系统。但是，霍尼韦尔并没有在蓝图中找到必要的细节，而是在没有验证 BBN 设计的接口（如图所示）是否能与 516 基本型号兼容的情况下就制造了 BBN 的机器。

In the wake of IMP Number 0’s gross failure, BBN’s hardware chief Ornstein began to go over the design with the Honeywell team. He discovered that no one at Honeywell seemed to understand in much detail how the BBN-designed interfaces were supposed to work. He was surprised to learn that the technicians building the first interface didn’t really understand the drawings.
